people.name: Bill Gates
people.description: Bill Gates is an American computer programmer and entrepreneur who confounded Microsoft Corporation, the world's largest personal-computer software company.

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari

books.title: The Future of Capitalism
books.author: Paul Collier
books.comments: Collier’s latest book is a thought-provoking look at a topic that’s top of mind for a lot of people right now. Although I don’t agree with him about everything—I think his analysis of the problem is better than his proposed solutions—his background as a development economist gives him a smart perspective on where capitalism is headed.

books.title: Upheaval
books.author: Jared Diamond
books.comments: I’m a big fan of everything Jared has written, and his latest is no exception. The book explores how societies react during moments of crisis. He uses a series of fascinating case studies to show how nations managed existential challenges like civil war, foreign threats, and general malaise. It sounds a bit depressing, but I finished the book even more optimistic about our ability to solve problems than I started.

people.name: Jeff Bezos
people.description: Jeff Bezos is an American entrepreneur who played a key role in the growth of e-commerce as the founder and chief executive officer of Amazon.com, Inc.
